data.text:
Introduction

I began watching The Chosen in 2020, and I loved it. It helped me connect with Jesus on a deeper, more personal level. However, after watching the premiere episodes of season three, I am saddened to say that the creators of the show have inserted a dangerous theology about healing into the storyline.

Background

In the first season, there is a scene with one of the twelve disciples called Little James. Little James has a disability and is struggling with the fact that Jesus is healing all the people who come to Him (Matthew 12:15), but has not yet healed him when he is visibly disabled. However, Little James ends up saying that he does not want to be like those who only have faith because Jesus healed them; he wants to prove he has faith without being healed.

While it is true that some had faith before they saw healing (the bleeding woman in Luke 8:43–48), Jesus never asked anyone to prove their faith before He healed them. And there are many others who did not have faith before they saw healing (the man at the pool of Bethesda in John 5:1–15).
